strings.Value: "Octavia's right, Reg. You didn't free yourselves on your own, remember? These people need our help."
"Regongar's right, Octavia. The death of these people is on Janush's conscience, not ours! If we let him go now, how many more souls will he destroy?"
"What are you waiting for? He's getting away!"
"We'll catch him! We just need to set these poor people free first..."
"No, we don't! Forget them! Can't you see the scum's getting away?"
"Reg, we can't leave them! We used to be slaves, too!"
"And we freed ourselves! Octavia, we owe nothing to these people!"

"But Janush... Ah, damn it! Fine, let him roll himself back to {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}. {g|Calistria}Calistria's{/g} not blind — he'll get his someday. Enough chatting, then — let's pull these idiots out of the fire!"
"I love you!" {n}After giving Regongar a quick hug, Octavia rushes to help the chained slaves.{/n}

"But these people..." {n}Octavia glances at the chained slaves, then looks toward Janush as he runs away.{/n} "...Fine. Forgive us — there's nothing we can do for you. But we WILL avenge you, you hear?"
{n}Regongar clenches Octavia's hand.{/n} "We'll get revenge, my love — for them, for us, for everything! Now let's run, before it's too late!"
"Wake up! Living people are burning right in front of you! How can we just let them die?!"
"You can't save everyone — and we can't let this asshole go. After him!"
"I'm no prophet, but here's my prediction: the prisoners will burn, the Maestro will escape, and you'll still be standing here arguing. Stop chatting and make a decision — any decision!"
"Will all you stop talk-talk?! Stab him, stab him, STAB HIM!"
